AU: Nishi, Y; Tabeta, S
AF: Nishi, Yoshiki; Tabeta, Shigeru
TI: Relation of material exchange between sea ice and water to a coupled ice-ocean ecosystem at the Hokkaido coastal region of the Okhotsk Sea
ID: SAROMA-KO LAGOON; COVERED ECOSYSTEM; NUMERICAL-MODEL; ALGAE; SALINITY; CARBON; PHYTOPLANKTON; SEDIMENTATION; BLOOMS; FLUXES
AB: In this paper, the material exchange between the sea ice and the water just below the ice, and its relation to the lower trophic ice system are examined using field observations in the Hokkaido coastal region of the Okhotsk Sea and a coupled ice-ocean ecosystem model which in detail formulates the material exchange between the ice and the water. The accuracy of the model is confirmed by a comparison of the results of the numerical computation with the observations. The estimation of the transport of the organic carbon and nutrients based on the computation demonstrates that the physical coupling effect between the ice and water plays a prominent role in supplying the nutrients from the water to the ice ecosystem and in efficiently releasing the organic matter produced by the primary producer in the ice (ice algae). As a result, this study quantitatively clarifies that the physical coupling effect, tidal mixing, and biological activity in the ice drive the material cycle in the ice and water under the ice.

AU: Tayama, T; Isobe, Y; Sakakibara, T; Sugawara, H; Aoki, Y; Sato, H
AF: Tayama, Takashi; Isobe, Yuta; Sakakibara, Toshiro; Sugawara, Hitoshi; Aoki, Yuji; Sato, Hideyuki
TI: Magnetic Phase Diagram of Pr1-xLaxFe4P12 (0 <= x <= 0.15)
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: PrFe4P12; filled skutterudite; impurity effect; magnetization; phase diagram; Fermi surface nesting
AB: We report measurements of the dc magnetization of a series of Pr1-xLaxFe4P12 single crystals (0 <= x <= 0.15). The nonmagnetic order (A phase) evolves to a short-range one at a very small La concentration of about 3%, above which ferromagnetic ordering occurs. Both the ferromagnetic transition temperature and spontaneous magnetization increase abruptly above x > 0.03, although the Weiss temperature decreases substantially with increasing x. These results suggest a competition between the A phase and ferromagnetic state, and the role of Fermi surface nesting on the A phase transition is emphasized. The effect of La impurities on the high-field ordered state (B phase) in the [111] direction is also presented.

AF: Udagawa, Masayuki; Hasegawa, Takumi; Takasu, Yuichi; Ogita, Norio; Suekuni, Koichiro; Avila, Marcos A.; Takabatake, Toshiro; Ishikawa, Yoshikazu; Takeda, Naoya; Nemoto, Yuichi; Goto, Terutaka; Sugawara, Hitoshi; Kikuchi, Daisuke; Sato, Hideyuki; Sekine, Chihiro; Shirotani, Ichimin; Yamaura, Jun-Ichi; Nagao, Yohei; Hiroi, Zenji
TI: Guest Ion Motion in Cage Structure Crystals Investigated by Raman Scattering
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: Raman scattering; Cage Compounds; Guest Ion; Anharmonicity; Rattling; Off-center Motion; Skutterudite; Clathrate; Pyrochlore; La3Pd20Ge6
AB: Last five years we have mainly investigated phonons in the following cage compounds by Raman scattering: RT4X12, A(8)Ga(16)Ge(30), La3Pd20Ge6, RB6, KOs2O6. From this systematic investigation we have clarified the following dynamical properties of the guest ion trapped in the large cages. The vibration of the guest ion is highly anharmonic due to weak atomic interaction between the guest ion and cage atom. This anharmonicity universally decreases the vibration energy of the guest ion with decreasing temperature. The existence of carriers decreases the interaction between the guest atoms and changes the dispersion curve of the guest ion mode to flat, which is the experimental evidence of the weak interaction between the guest atoms. For thermoelectricity, it is found in A(8)Ga(16)Ge(30) that the off-center rattling decreases lattice thermal conductivity.

AU: Sakakibara, T; Yano, K; Sato, H; Tayama, T; Custers, J; Sugawara, H; Aoki, Y; Sato, H
AF: Sakakibara, Toshiro; Yano, Kazuhiro; Sato, Hidekazu; Tayama, Takashi; Custers, Jeroen; Sugawara, Hitoshi; Aoki, Yuji; Sato, Hideyuki
TI: Multipole Phenomena and Superconductivity in Pr-based Filled Skutterudites
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: skutterudite; specific heat; magnetization; unconventional superconductivity; gap structure; multipole order
AB: Field-orientation dependent specific heat C(H, theta) and the magnetization M(H, theta) have been measured on the Pr-based filled skutterudite compounds PrOs4Sb12 and PrFe4P12. In PrOs4Sb12, fourfold angular oscillations of C(H, theta) have been observed in the normal state above the upper critical field H-c2 as well as in the vortex state. Field variation of the normalstate oscillation in C(H, theta) strongly suggests that antiferroquadrupolar fluctuations exist in the wide region above H-c2. The oscillation exhibits a sign reversal below H-c2, whose origin is attributed to the nodal structure in which the superconducting gap takes minima (point nodes) along [100] directions. In PrFe4P12, an exotic ordered phase (A-phase) below T-A(H = 0)= 6.5 K has been examined. Both M(H, theta) within the A-phase and T-A(H, theta) show a smooth angular variation with a cubic anisotropy for H rotated in the (001) and (1 (1) over bar0) planes. The results strongly suggest that cubic symmetry is preserved in the A-phase; the order parameter is of Gamma(+)(1) type.

AU: Masaki, S; Mito, T; Wada, S; Sugawara, H; Kikuchi, D; Sato, H; Takigawa, M; Takeda, N; Zheng, GQ
AF: Masaki, Satoru; Mito, Takeshi; Wada, Shinji; Sugawara, Hitoshi; Kikuchi, Daisuke; Sato, Hideyuki; Takigawa, Masashi; Takeda, Naoya; Zheng, Guo-qing
TI: P-31-NMR study in single crystal SmRu4P12
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: SmRu4P12; NMR; single crystal; multipolar ordering; metal-insulator transition; filled skutterudite
AB: In order to obtain microscopic information about the metal-insulator (M-I) transition in SmRu4P12, P-31-nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) measurements using a single crystal have been carried out. Each P-31-NMR line splits into two lines below the M-I transition temperature, consistent with the antiferro-type ordered structure with a wave vector q = (1, 0, 0) proposed by the previous Ru-101-NQR experiments. We also found a remarkable kink in the temperature dependence of the resonance frequencies at 12.5K, which may be related to an anomaly in the temperature dependence of the order parameter.

AU: Takeda, N; Mitamura, H; Kindo, K
AF: Takeda, Naoya; Mitamura, Hiroyuki; Kindo, Koichi
TI: Metamagnetism of ferromagnetic Kondo compound SmFe4P12
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: filled skutterudite; SmFe4P12; metamagnetism; heavy fermion
AB: SmFe4P12 is a novel ferromagnetic heavy fermion compound with a Curie temperature T-c of 1.6K. The electronic specific heat coefficient is 370 mJ/mol.K-2. The magnetic susceptibility of La1-xSmxFe4P12 (0.6 <= x <= 0.85) with a paramagnetic ground state shows a broad maximum around 15K. This phenomenon reminds us the case of CeRu2Si2 which is in the boundary of itinerant and localized 4f-state. We measured the magnetization up to 42T and found metamagnetic crossover at 22T. The metamagnetism disappears with increasing temperature. Possible mechanism of the metamagnetism is discussed.

AU: Lee, CH; Yoshizawa, H; Avila, MA; Hase, I; Kihou, K; Takabatake, T
AF: Lee, Chul-Ho; Yoshizawa, Hideki; Avila, Marcos A.; Hase, Izumi; Kihou, Kunihiro; Takabatake, Toshiro
TI: Phonon Dynamics of Type-I Clathrate Sr8Ga16Ge30 Studied by Inelastic Neutron Scattering
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: Type-I clathrate; phonon dispersion; rattling; cage compound; inelastic neutron scattering
AB: The phonon dynamics of type-I clathrates Sr8Ga16Ge30 have been studied at room temperature by inelastic neutron scattering. Optical phonons associated with large vibrations of Sr atoms in large tetrakaidecahedral cages, (Ga,Ge)(24), are observed at a relatively low energy of E similar to 4 meV. Analysis based on a Born-von Karman force model shows that the longitudinal force constants between the Sr atoms and the oversized cages has a small value of about 0.008 mdyn/angstrom. The results indicate that the Sr atoms are very loosely bound to the surrounding oversized cages.

AU: Kondo, A; Tou, H; Sera, M; Iga, F; Sakakibara, T
AF: Kondo, Akihiro; Tou, Hideki; Sera, Masafumi; Iga, Fumitoshi; Sakakibara, Toshiro
TI: Suppression of Phase IV in CexLa1-xB6 by R-ion Doping
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: CexLa1-xB6; phase IV; hidden order; octupole order; multipole interaction
AB: We have studied the effect of Nd doping on phase IV of Ce(0.65)NdyLa(0.35-y)B(6) (y = 0.03, and 0.05) and Ce0.6Nd0.05La0.35B6 to obtain the information on the order parameter in phase IV. The suppression of phase IV by Nd doping is not so large for x <= 0.65 different from the rapid suppression of phase IV for x = 0.7. Based on these results, we discuss the importance of the different distance dependence of O-xy-AFQ, T-xyz-AFO, AF exchange and the interaction forming phase IV in CexLa1-xB6.

AU: Iwasa, K; Itobe, S; Yang, CP; Murakami, Y; Kohgi, M; Kuwahara, K; Sugawara, H; Sato, H; Aso, N; Tayama, T; Sakakibara, T
AF: Iwasa, Kazuaki; Itobe, Shouhei; Yang, Changping; Murakami, Youichi; Kohgi, Masahumi; Kuwahara, Keitaro; Sugawara, Hitoshi; Sato, Hideyuki; Aso, Naofumi; Tayama, Takashi; Sakakibara, Toshiro
TI: Magnetic Correlation in the Ordered Phase of CeOs4Sb12
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: Kondo semiconductor; weak magnetism; c-f hybridization
AB: We performed neutron diffraction and magnetization measurements to reveal the nature of phase transition of a Kondo semiconductor CeOs4Sb12. Weak antiferromagnetic (AFM) reflections characterized by a wave vector q = (1 0 0) were observed, and the ordered moment value is around 0.07 mu(B)/Ce at zero magnetic field. The AFM structure is rapidly suppressed by magnetic field of 1 T, in contrast to the transition temperature suggested to be enhanced by magnetic field. Only ferromagnetic correlation is observed above 1 T. Such drastic variation of the magnetic correlation is closely connected into the transport properties; the AFM ordered phase below 1 T and the induced ferromagnetic state above 1 T correspond to the semiconducting and metallic states, respectively.

AU: Kasahara, S; Hirata, K; Takeya, H; Tamegai, T; Sugawara, H; Kikuchi, D; Sato, H
AF: Kasahara, Shigeru; Hirata, Kazuto; Takeya, Hiroyuki; Tamegai, Tsuyoshi; Sugawara, Hitoshi; Kikuchi, Daisuke; Sato, Hideyuki
TI: Superconducting Double Transition in PrOs4Sb12 Probed by Local Magnetization Measurements and Magneto-Optical Imaging
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: Filled skutterudites; PrOs4Sb12; Local magnetization; Magneto-optical imaging; specific heat; double transition
AB: Double superconducting transition in PrOs4Sb12 has been studied carefully by performing the local magnetization measurements using micro-Hall probe and the magneto-optical imaging. Local magnetization curves for each element of the Hall probe reveal that there exists a significant difference in the transition temperature at each point; two phases which give different T-c's are stabilized in the crystal. Magneto-optical imaging at T < T-c2 and T-c2 < T < T-c1 also reveals a non-uniform superconducting nature. The characteristics of superconducting double transition in PrOs4Sb12 are discussed based on the local field inductions at multi-points.

AU: Nakai, Y; Hayashi, Y; Kitagawa, K; Ishida, K; Sugawara, H; Kikuchi, D; Sato, H
AF: Nakai, Y.; Hayashi, Y.; Kitagawa, K.; Ishida, K.; Sugawara, H.; Kikuchi, D.; Sato, H.
TI: Evidence of the bound states of the vortex state in an s-wave superconductor proved by NMR measurements
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: Filled skutterudite; Superconductivity; Vortex state; NMR
AB: In the s-wave superconductor LaRu4P12 (T-c=7.2 K), a clear Redfield pattern was observed below T-c, which arises from a triangular lattice. We observed distinct frequency dependence of the spin-lattice relaxation rate 1/T-1 in the vortex state in contrast to the normal state. In addition, from the T-dependence of 1/T1T measured at different frequencies, 1/T1T at the vortex core is considered to be greater than that in the normal state, indicating that the LDOS in the vortex core region is higher than that in the normal state. This enhancement of the LDOS in the core region can be understood in terms of the bound states inside a vortex core.

AU: Yanase, Y; Sigrist, M
AF: Yanase, Youichi; Sigrist, Manfred
TI: Helical Superconductivity in Non-centrosymmetric Superconductors with dominantly Spin Triplet Pairing
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: Non-centrosymmetric superconductor; helical superconductivity; antiferromagnetism
AB: The helical superconducting (SC) state in non-centrosymmetric superconductors (NCSC) with dominantly p-wave pairing is investigated for the case of the heavy fermion superconductor CePt3Si. The non-linear increase of the helicity leads to a significant suppression of paramagnetic depairing effect and the increase of spin susceptibility below T-c. The influence of AFM order is examined. The pairing state in CePt3Si is discussed by comparing our theoretical results with experiments.

AU: Tatematsu, K; Takeda, N; Araki, Y; Fukuda, K; Yamada, Y; Nishioka, T; Kodama, K; Shimizu, K; Matsushita, T; Wada, N; Narazu, S; Takabatake, T
AF: Tatematsu, Kenji; Takeda, Naoya; Araki, Yoshitaka; Fukuda, Kazunori; Yamada, Yuh; Nishioka, Takashi; Kodama, Kazuto; Shimizu, Kengo; Matsushita, Taku; Wada, Nobuo; Narazu, Shouta; Takabatake, Toshiro
TI: Heavy Fermion Behaviors of Tm2Rh12P7
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: filled skutterudite; Tm2Rh12P7; specific heat; heavy fermion
AB: We present the magnetic susceptibility, the electrical resistivity and the low-temperature specific heat of Tm2Rh12P7. This compound crystallizes in the hexagonal Ho2Rh12As7-type structure. Rare-earth ions in this structure occupy voids of binary compound Rh12As7. This situation has a great resemblance to the relation between filled skutterudites and unfilled skutterudites. The magnetic susceptibility of Tm2Rh12P7 follows a Curie-Weiss law down to 2K, but there is a very small kink at 3.1K. The specific heat shows a peak at 3.1K, indicating a phase transition. C/T extrapolating to 0K has a very large value of about 0.4J/mol-Tm.K-2. This result suggests that Tm2Rh12P7 is the first Tm-based heavy fermion compound.

TI: Pressure Effect on Ferromagnet UTeS
SO: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
DE: UTeS; ferromagnet
AB: The ferromagnet UTeS with the Curie temperature T-C = 87 K has been studied by measuring the electrical resistivity rho under high pressure using a single crystal sample grown by the chemical transport method. The electrical resistivity at room temperature rho(RT) decreases with increasing pressure. T-C rapidly increases from 87 K at 0 GPa to 166 K at 8 GPa. These results suggest that there is a correlation between the electrical conductivity and the magnetic transition temperature. In contrast to the behavior of rho(RT), the residual resistivity rho(0) is almost independent of pressure.

AU: Hitani, K; Yokoo, S; Honda, N; Usui, T; Yamagami, S; Amano, S
AF: Hitani, Kouichiro; Yokoo, Seiichi; Honda, Norihiko; Usui, Tomohiko; Yamagami, Satoru; Amano, Shiro
TI: Transplantation of a sheet of human corneal endothelial cell in a rabbit model
ID: CULTURED ADULT HUMAN; RECIPIENTS IN-VITRO; KERATOPLASTY; MEMBRANE; GROWTH; RECONSTRUCTION; COLLAGEN; VIVO
AB: Purpose: To develop a novel method for constructing a sheet of human corneal endothelial cells (HCECs) and examine the properties of the HCEC sheet. Methods: HCECs were cultured on a cell culture insert for a week; ethylenediamine tetraacetic acid was applied from the bottom of the cell culture insert to attenuate the attachment of HCECs. The sheet of HCECs was constructed by bluntly detaching the cell sheet with a spatula. HCEC cell sheets were placed on the posterior surface of excised rabbit corneal buttons and transplanted onto the corneal beds of donor rabbits. In two eyes from the HCEC sheet group, cultured HCECs were labeled with PKH26 to observe the localization of HCECs after transplantation. Results: Cultured HCECs could be bluntly detached en bloc from the bottom of a culture insert. Immunostaining for ZO-1, Na+, K+-ATPase, laminin, fibronectin, and type IV collagen was positive in the cell sheet. The average cell density in a HCEC sheet was 2,425 cells/mm(2). After HCEC sheet transplantation, corneal edema decreased much earlier in the HCEC group than in the control group. In the HCEC sheet group, the monolayer of continuous cells attached to the posterior surface of the transplanted rabbit cornea and the posterior surface of transplanted cornea was covered with PKH26-labeled cells. The average endothelial cell density in the HCEC sheet group seven days postoperatively was 2,244 cells/mm(2). Conclusions: This technique for producing an HCEC sheet might be useful in regenerative medicine for the cornea and reconstruction of the corneal endothelium.
